summary: Discovered fundamental architectural flaw in DovetailingChain that blocks cross-sign temporal propagation. The two-chain architecture (forward=GContent, backward=HContent) cannot support G/H propagation across the time-zero boundary.

artifacts.summary: Detailed analysis of DovetailingChain cross-sign blocking issue and comparison of approaches

partial_progress.details: Phase 1 (cross-sign propagation) cannot proceed due to fundamental architecture flaw. The backward chain uses HContent seeds which do not propagate G formulas, and augmented seed approach fails because Lindenbaum can add conflicting H(neg p) while G(p) is in M_0.
partial_progress.blocking_reason: The two-chain architecture fundamentally cannot support cross-sign temporal propagation

completion_data.completion_summary: Analysis revealed DovetailingChain's two-chain architecture (forward=GContent, backward=HContent) fundamentally cannot support cross-sign temporal propagation. G formulas cannot propagate through backward chain, and augmented seed approach fails due to Lindenbaum conflicts. Plan requires architectural redesign.

recommendations.option_a: Pivot to RecursiveSeed approach (13 sorries, different issues)
recommendations.option_b: Redesign DovetailingChain with unified chain construction (combined G/H content)
recommendations.option_c: Accept technical debt and document sorries as known limitations
recommendations.rationale: Unified chain would inherit same-sign proofs while adding cross-sign support. Estimated 20-30 hours total.
